acknowledgments.summary: Kaspersky Lab reported this vulnerability to Yokogawa, and JPCERT reported this vulnerability to NCCIC.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to remotely upload files, allowing execution of arbitrary code.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Food and Agriculture
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-19-029-01 - Web Scraped Version

cwe.name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type

notes.text: UNRESTRICTED UPLOAD OF FILE WITH DANGEROUS TYPE CWE-434: Multiple Yokogawa products utilize a service intended to verify the validity of licensed products being utilized. The service running on affected products does not properly restrict the upload of potentially malicious files, which could result in execution of arbitrary code. CVE-2019-5909 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Yokogawa recommends users of affected devices and versions update to the latest available release. Details about the products, affected revisions, and suggested mitigations are available in the Yokogawa Security Advisory Report “YSAR-198-0001: Vulnerability of access control in License Manager Service of Yokogawa products.”  This advisory can be found at the following location:https://web-material3.yokogawa.com/1/20653/files/YSAR-19-0001-E.pdfFor questions related to this report and details regarding how to update to the newest revision, please visit the Yokogawa security website (registration required):  https://contact.yokogawa.com/cs/gw?c-id=000498
